entity1.name: supernatural
entity1.description: Narratives or tales involving supernatural entities, often used to explain unexplained phenomena or to entertain.;;;Events or experiences that are beyond the scope of scientific explanation and often attributed to spiritual or paranormal causes.;;;Spirits or apparitions of deceased individuals, often believed to haunt specific locations.;;;Visible manifestations of spirits or paranormal entities, often perceived as ghostly figures or images.;;;Spirits or apparitions of deceased individuals that are believed to haunt certain places or people.;;;Spirits or souls of deceased individuals, believed by some to exist in an afterlife and sometimes interact with the living world.;;;Intangible beings often associated with the afterlife or paranormal phenomena.;;;Phenomena that are not subject to the laws of nature and cannot be explained by scientific means, often associated with spiritual or paranormal activities.;;;Spirits or apparitions of deceased individuals, often believed to haunt specific locations or people.;;;Spirits or apparitions, often believed to be the souls of deceased individuals.;;;Non-physical entities often believed to exist in a realm beyond the physical world, sometimes associated with deceased individuals or natural phenomena.;;;Deceptive appearances or perceptions that can mislead one's senses or understanding.;;;Malevolent supernatural beings often associated with evil or negative forces.;;;A supernatural being or spirit, often believed to be the soul or spirit of a deceased person.;;;Folklore and oral traditions that describe supernatural events involving ghosts, often passed down through generations within a culture.;;;A perceived manifestation of a spirit or entity from another realm, often associated with hauntings or paranormal activity.;;;Beings or occurrences that are beyond normal scientific understanding and explanation, often associated with supernatural or unexplained events.;;;Spirits or apparitions of deceased people that are believed by some to haunt specific locations or individuals.;;;Phenomena that are beyond the scope of normal scientific understanding and explanation, often involving supernatural elements.;;;A situation or thing that is not known about or familiar to someone.;;;Heavenly beings that are often considered messengers of God in various religions.;;;Experiences or sightings that are believed to involve ghosts or supernatural entities.;;;Non-physical beings often associated with religious or spiritual beliefs.;;;Spirits or souls of deceased individuals, often believed to haunt specific locations or people.;;;Spirits or souls of deceased individuals, believed to haunt places, objects, or people.;;;Sounds that cannot be attributed to known sources and are often associated with paranormal activity.;;;A non-physical aspect of the world that is often associated with religious or supernatural beliefs.;;;A realm that encompasses phenomena and entities beyond the scope of scientific explanation, including ghosts, spirits, and other paranormal activities.;;;A feeling or sensation of something being present, often unexplained and attributed to supernatural causes.;;;Spirits of deceased individuals that are believed to haunt places, objects, or people.;;;A category of phenomena that are considered to be beyond scientific explanation and often associated with the paranormal or spiritual.
entity1.chunkid: Why People Believe in Ghosts21;;;Why People Believe in Ghosts7;;;Why People Believe in Ghosts3;;;Why People Believe in Ghosts14;;;Why People Believe in Ghosts16;;;Why People Believe in Ghosts25;;;Why People Believe in Ghosts17;;;Why People Believe in Ghosts19;;;Why People Believe in Ghosts6;;;Why People Believe in Ghosts4;;;Why People Believe in Ghosts8;;;Why People Believe in Ghosts10;;;Why People Believe in Ghosts20;;;Why People Believe in Ghosts22;;;Why People Believe in Ghosts15;;;Why People Believe in Ghosts24;;;Why People Believe in Ghosts12;;;Why People Believe in Ghosts1

entity7.name: popular culture
entity7.description: The set of practices, beliefs, and objects that are dominant or prevalent in a society, widely accessible, and often disseminated by the media.

entity8.name: movies
entity8.description: A series of moving images, usually accompanied by sound, presented on a screen for entertainment or educational purposes.

entity9.name: TV shows
entity9.description: Television programs that are broadcast in regular intervals and can be either fictional or non-fictional.

entity10.name: books
entity10.description: Written works or compositions published in print or electronic form, often containing stories, information, or ideas.

entity20.name: skeptics
entity20.description: A group of individuals who tend to doubt the validity or truth of claims without sufficient evidence.;;;A group of individuals who tend to doubt the validity or authenticity of certain claims, especially those related to paranormal experiences.
entity20.chunkid: Why People Believe in Ghosts14;;;Why People Believe in Ghosts24

entity22.name: Psychological factors
entity22.description: Elements of the mind and mental processes that influence behavior and beliefs.

entity25.name: immortality
entity25.description: The state of being able to live forever without dying.

entity29.name: afterlife
entity29.description: The belief in life after death, where the consciousness or soul continues to exist in another form or place.

entity30.name: cultural and religious beliefs
entity30.description: A set of shared attitudes, values, goals, and practices that characterize a group or society.;;;A set of shared attitudes, values, goals, and practices that are characteristic of a particular social or ethnic group, often intertwined with spiritual or supernatural elements.
entity30.chunkid: Why People Believe in Ghosts19;;;Why People Believe in Ghosts21

entity33.name: ancestors
entity33.description: Deceased members of one's family, particularly those from previous generations who are often revered in various cultural practices and beliefs.

entity45.name: superstitions
entity45.description: Irrational beliefs or practices based on fear of the unknown, magic, chance, or the influence of supernatural forces.
